00007         parse_search_datetime, unescape_html

00010 class ResultSet(list):
00011     """A list like object that holds results from a Twitter API query."""
00012 
00013 
00014 class Model(object):
00015 
00016     def __init__(self, api=None):
00017         self._api = api
00018 
00019     def __getstate__(self):
00020         # pickle
00021         pickle = dict(self.__dict__)
00022         try:
00023             del pickle['_api']  # do not pickle the API reference
00024         except KeyError:
00025             pass
00026         return pickle
00027 
00028     @classmethod
00029     def parse(cls, api, json):
00030         """Parse a JSON object into a model instance."""
00031         raise NotImplementedError
00032 
00033     @classmethod
00034     def parse_list(cls, api, json_list):
00035         """Parse a list of JSON objects into a result set of model instances."""
00036         results = ResultSet()
00037         for obj in json_list:
00038             if obj:
00039                 results.append(cls.parse(api, obj))
00040         return results

00043 class Status(Model):
00044 
00045     @classmethod
00046     def parse(cls, api, json):
00047         status = cls(api)
00048         for k, v in json.items():
00049             if k == 'user':
00050                 user_model = getattr(api.parser.model_factory, 'user')
00051                 user = user_model.parse(api, v)
00052                 setattr(status, 'author', user)
00053                 setattr(status, 'user', user)  # DEPRECIATED
00054             elif k == 'created_at':
00055                 setattr(status, k, parse_datetime(v))
00056             elif k == 'source':
00057                 if '<' in v:
00058                     setattr(status, k, parse_html_value(v))
00059                     setattr(status, 'source_url', parse_a_href(v))
00060                 else:
00061                     setattr(status, k, v)
00062                     setattr(status, 'source_url', None)
00063             elif k == 'retweeted_status':
00064                 setattr(status, k, Status.parse(api, v))
00065             else:
00066                 setattr(status, k, v)
00067         return status
00068 
00069     def destroy(self):
00070         return self._api.destroy_status(self.id)
00071 
00072     def retweet(self):
00073         return self._api.retweet(self.id)
00074 
00075     def retweets(self):
00076         return self._api.retweets(self.id)
00077 
00078     def favorite(self):
00079         return self._api.create_favorite(self.id)

00082 class User(Model):
00083 
00084     @classmethod
00085     def parse(cls, api, json):
00086         user = cls(api)
00087         for k, v in json.items():
00088             if k == 'created_at':
00089                 setattr(user, k, parse_datetime(v))
00090             elif k == 'status':
00091                 setattr(user, k, Status.parse(api, v))
00092             elif k == 'following':
00093                 # twitter sets this to null if it is false
00094                 if v is True:
00095                     setattr(user, k, True)
00096                 else:
00097                     setattr(user, k, False)
00098             else:
00099                 setattr(user, k, v)
00100         return user
00101 
00102     @classmethod
00103     def parse_list(cls, api, json_list):
00104         if isinstance(json_list, list):
00105             item_list = json_list
00106         else:
00107             item_list = json_list['users']
00108 
00109         results = ResultSet()
00110         for obj in item_list:
00111             results.append(cls.parse(api, obj))
00112         return results
00113 
00114     def timeline(self, **kargs):
00115         return self._api.user_timeline(user_id=self.id, **kargs)
00116 
00117     def friends(self, **kargs):
00118         return self._api.friends(user_id=self.id, **kargs)
00119 
00120     def followers(self, **kargs):
00121         return self._api.followers(user_id=self.id, **kargs)
00122 
00123     def follow(self):
00124         self._api.create_friendship(user_id=self.id)
00125         self.following = True
00126 
00127     def unfollow(self):
00128         self._api.destroy_friendship(user_id=self.id)
00129         self.following = False
00130 
00131     def lists_memberships(self, *args, **kargs):
00132         return self._api.lists_memberships(user=self.screen_name, *args, **kargs)
00133 
00134     def lists_subscriptions(self, *args, **kargs):
00135         return self._api.lists_subscriptions(user=self.screen_name, *args, **kargs)
00136 
00137     def lists(self, *args, **kargs):
00138         return self._api.lists(user=self.screen_name, *args, **kargs)
00139 
00140     def followers_ids(self, *args, **kargs):
00141         return self._api.followers_ids(user_id=self.id, *args, **kargs)

00144 class DirectMessage(Model):
00145 
00146     @classmethod
00147     def parse(cls, api, json):
00148         dm = cls(api)
00149         for k, v in json.items():
00150             if k == 'sender' or k == 'recipient':
00151                 setattr(dm, k, User.parse(api, v))
00152             elif k == 'created_at':
00153                 setattr(dm, k, parse_datetime(v))
00154             else:
00155                 setattr(dm, k, v)
00156         return dm
00157 
00158     def destroy(self):
00159         return self._api.destroy_direct_message(self.id)

00162 class Friendship(Model):
00163 
00164     @classmethod
00165     def parse(cls, api, json):
00166         relationship = json['relationship']
00167 
00168         # parse source
00169         source = cls(api)
00170         for k, v in relationship['source'].items():
00171             setattr(source, k, v)
00172 
00173         # parse target
00174         target = cls(api)
00175         for k, v in relationship['target'].items():
00176             setattr(target, k, v)
00177 
00178         return source, target
00179

00181 class SavedSearch(Model):
00182 
00183     @classmethod
00184     def parse(cls, api, json):
00185         ss = cls(api)
00186         for k, v in json.items():
00187             if k == 'created_at':
00188                 setattr(ss, k, parse_datetime(v))
00189             else:
00190                 setattr(ss, k, v)
00191         return ss

00193     def destroy(self):
00194         return self._api.destroy_saved_search(self.id)

00197 class SearchResult(Model):
00198 
00199     @classmethod
00200     def parse(cls, api, json):
00201         result = cls()
00202         for k, v in json.items():
00203             if k == 'created_at':
00204                 setattr(result, k, parse_search_datetime(v))
00205             elif k == 'source':
00206                 setattr(result, k, parse_html_value(unescape_html(v)))
00207             else:
00208                 setattr(result, k, v)
00209         return result
00210 
00211     @classmethod
00212     def parse_list(cls, api, json_list, result_set=None):
00213         results = ResultSet()
00214         results.max_id = json_list.get('max_id')
00215         results.since_id = json_list.get('since_id')
00216         results.refresh_url = json_list.get('refresh_url')
00217         results.next_page = json_list.get('next_page')
00218         results.results_per_page = json_list.get('results_per_page')
00219         results.page = json_list.get('page')
00220         results.completed_in = json_list.get('completed_in')
00221         results.query = json_list.get('query')
00222 
00223         for obj in json_list['results']:
00224             results.append(cls.parse(api, obj))
00225         return results

00228 class List(Model):
00229 
00230     @classmethod
00231     def parse(cls, api, json):
00232         lst = List(api)
00233         for k,v in json.items():
00234             if k == 'user':
00235                 setattr(lst, k, User.parse(api, v))
00236             else:
00237                 setattr(lst, k, v)
00238         return lst
00239 
00240     @classmethod
00241     def parse_list(cls, api, json_list, result_set=None):
00242         results = ResultSet()
00243         for obj in json_list['lists']:
00244             results.append(cls.parse(api, obj))
00245         return results

00280 class Relation(Model):
00281     @classmethod
00282     def parse(cls, api, json):
00283         result = cls(api)
00284         for k,v in json.items():
00285             if k == 'value' and json['kind'] in ['Tweet', 'LookedupStatus']:
00286                 setattr(result, k, Status.parse(api, v))
00287             elif k == 'results':
00288                 setattr(result, k, Relation.parse_list(api, v))
00289             else:
00290                 setattr(result, k, v)
00291         return result
00292

00294 class JSONModel(Model):
00295 
00296     @classmethod
00297     def parse(cls, api, json):
00298         return json

00301 class IDModel(Model):
00302 
00303     @classmethod
00304     def parse(cls, api, json):
00305         if isinstance(json, list):
00306             return json
00307         else:
00308             return json['ids']

00310 
00311 class ModelFactory(object):
00312     """
00313     Used by parsers for creating instances
00314     of models. You may subclass this factory
00315     to add your own extended models.
00316     """
00317 
00318     status = Status
00319     user = User
00320     direct_message = DirectMessage
00321     friendship = Friendship
00322     saved_search = SavedSearch
00323     search_result = SearchResult
00324     list = List
00325     relation = Relation
00326 
00327     json = JSONModel
00328     ids = IDModel
